title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Friday, September 29 (game #613)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Eufy's all-seeing smart home cams can shoot your videos from multiple angles
description: Consisting of four models, Eufy's dual-camera lineup can combine multiple clips into one seamless videos.

title: UltraRAM go! Here’s a glimpse at what the future of memory and storage could look like if this UK startup succeeds
description: Quinas is being backed by the UK government to bring its cutting-edge memory technology to the masses .

title: Scientists want to add broadband technology to your brain — but it’s not what you think
description: Known as biphasic quasistatic brain communication, the technology will boost the body’s own electronic signaling system.

title: This devious phishing scam makes it look like dodgy emails are actually safe
description: Hackers are using the zero-font tactic on phishing emails now, lulling victims into a false sense of security.

title: Counter-Strike 2 bug prevents you from seeing smoke grenades at a distance on Steam Deck
description: It seems that Counter-Strike 2 may have a visual bug on Steam Deck that is preventing players from seeing smoke grenades at a distance.

title: Top VPN providers get recognized as secure and ethical products
description: VPN Trust Seal badge is as a clear indicator of companies' commitment to user safety. Check out which providers are already on the list.

title: Fortnite developer Epic Games is laying off over 800 employees
description: Epic Games is laying off 16% of its workforce, it's been revealed.

title: Meta AI is coming to your social media apps - and I’ve already forgotten about ChatGPT
description: Meta’s AI assistants are coming to Instagram, Messenger and WhatsApp - ChatGPT should be worried.

title: Cyberpunk 2077 devs have no plans for any further “big updates”, focus will turn to sequel instead
description: CD Projekt Red has confirmed that Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty and patch 2.0 will be the final updates to the game.

title: Reddit will now force targeted ads on everyone as the site becomes increasingly monetized
description: Reddit announced it would be removing user options to control how collected data is used by advertisers.

title: Fitbit Charge 6 has arrived, and it's (almost) like a longer-lasting Pixel Watch
description: Fitbit Charge 5 gets Google Maps, YouTube Music, Google Wallet and a  hefty 7-day battery life.

title: Larian reveals the top 20 Baldur's Gate 3 multiclass builds with the Rogue Ranger mix being the most popular
description: Larian Studios has revealed the top 20 most popular multiclass builds players are running in Baldur's Gate 3.

title: Counter-Strike 2's release has brought with it some much-needed changes
description: CS2 is finally out, and players can enjoy some much-needed changes.

title: Meta says Quest for Business VR will launch next month
description: Meta announces additional features to enhance business productivity in the metaverse.

title: VPN maker Nord Security nets $100m funding
description: Nord hints at possible mergers and acquisitions as it expects the cybersecurity market to keep growing.

title: Cities: Skylines 2 console release delayed to 2024
description: Cities: Skylines 2's PS5 and Xbox Series X|S launch has been delayed to 2024 - its PC release remains the same, however.

title: Windows 11 can now be set up specifically for developers
description: Updated Windows 11 sees developers receive special attention and exciting extra features.

title: Norton Small Business wants to keep your start-up safe from security threats
description: Norton suite looks to bring SMB cybersecurity up to enterprise standards without the hassle of a separate department.

title: Rega’s stunning new turntable is one of the coolest vinyl spinners I’ve ever seen
description: Rega’s new Naia turntable has a chassis made by a Formula 1 race car specialist and a £12,000 price tag.

title: Tubi taps up ChatGPT to make finding great free movies and shows easier
description: Find what you want to watch on Tubi more easily with Rabbit AI, which isn't a rabbit and isn't really AI either.

title: Raspberry Pi 5 is a seriously supercharged new brain for your DIY projects
description: You won’t have to wait until next year for the Raspberry Pi 5 after all – the much-improved board will arrive in October.

title: Photoshop on the web finally launches, but it's still not a free Canva rival
description: Adobe has finally launched its web-based version of Photoshop, but it remains a too pricey alternative to Canva.

title: Xbox Cloud Gaming arrives on Meta Quest in December with Starfield and Halo Infinite to be playable
description: Xbox Cloud Gaming is officially coming to the Meta Quest 3 in December.

title: Google Pixel 8 event - new iPhone rivals, new Watch and everything to expect
description: The next Made by Google event will see the reveal of the Pixel 8, Pixel 8 Pro and Pixel Watch 2.

title: Core i7-14700KF leak gets us even more excited for Intel's 14th-gen desktop CPU
description: The rumor mill continues to insist that one Raptor Lake Refresh processor in particular will be excellent.

title: AMD Ryzen 8000 CPUs could make an appearance in tablets early next year
description: AMD’s Ryzen 8000 processors are expected to power new tablets from PC maker Minisforum.

title: Teardown is getting two new DLCs after it arrives on PS5 and Xbox Series X
description: Players will finally be able to enjoy Teardown and all its upcoming DLC on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S.

title: Microsoft Edge might be making some major changes to your saved passwords
description: A new update to on Microsoft's end has been showing users' passwords as GUID strings, but there is a quick fix.

title: Fortnite V-Bucks are going to get more expensive in multiple countries, including the United States
description: Fortnite has confirmed pricing changes for V-Bucks and some other in-game purchases for a number of countries next month.

title: Blizzard has laid off 10 members of the Hearthstone development team
description: Blizzard Entertainment has laid off several members of the Hearthstone development team.

title: Billions of passwords and email addresses have been leaked online - so change your logins now
description: Vast unprotected database of 3.8 billion login and password records found online.

title: ChatGPT can finally get up-to-date answers from the internet – here's how
description: OpenAI has reinstated ChatGPT's ability to search the web, which means it knows about recent facts and events.

title: Sega cancels extraction shooter Hyenas less than two weeks after its closed beta
description: Sega has canceled Creative Assembly's extraction FPS Hyenas, as well as some "unannounced titles under development".

title: The FTC has restarted its fight against Microsoft’s Activision acquisition deal
description: The FTC has re-opened its fight against Microsoft's proposed acquisition of Activision, and aims to resolve matter "fully and expeditiously".

title: Chinese hackers are targeting Cisco routers - so patch now
description: Cisco routers are coming under attack once again, so make sure your endpoints are protected.

title: Remedy confirms Alan Wake 2 will have a performance mode
description: Alan Wake 2 will have a performance mode despite being built for a 30 FPS experience.

description: From Devil May Cry to Scott Pilgrim, Netflix's DROP 01 event delivered a bunch of great new animated show announcements.

title: Stardew Valley update 1.6 will add a new farm type, a major festival, plus "secrets & more"
description: Stardew Valley has a new update coming soon, and a mass of content is being added to sink your teeth into once it rolls out.

title: Update Google Chrome now - there's another serious security flaw in the wild
description: Exploit for potentially serious Google Chrome security flaw seen in the wild.

title: Scientists transformed a cockroach into a remote-controlled zombie cyborg using an electrical backpack — and no, there’s absolutely nothing to be afraid of
description: Scientists inflicted no pain on their remote-controlled cockroaches by using non-invasive electrodes.

title: PlayStation boss Jim Ryan is leaving Sony
description: Jim Ryan is leaving his role at the company in March 2024 after nearly 30 years with the company
